resources.string: KUKA youBot Android App provide an alternative user interface (UI) for controlling youBot. Unlike "button-type" controller (joypad or keyboard), Android accommodate UI design. Therefore, an intuitive and user friendly controller for KUKA youBot Android can be developed.

KUKA youBot Android App uses RFCOMM Bluetooth connection where Android phone act as the client and youBotAndroid act as the server. youBotandroid is another program which can be run on a machine that is connected to KUKA youBot or KUKA youBot PC. youBot API are implemented in youBotAndroid. Pairing process should be performed before running youBotAndroid.

Currently, android App can control base and arm of KUKA youBot separately. There are 2 ways to control the arm movement (joint position and joint velocity) 5 modes to control the base movement (Shift, Drive, Accel, Slider and Cartesian).

"important note : Pairing process with YouBot device should be executed BEFORE running YouBot API and running Android Controller GUI"

Arm joint position allows user to move youBot arm into a pose that are define through its joint angles (in radian or degree). After the desired joint angles are set, the values can be send to android pc client which will move the arm to its designated pose. The values are limited based on youBot arm joint limit.

Arm joint velocity allows user to rotate a joint or joints of the KUKA youBot arm. Moving a slider to the right side will rotate the corresponding joint to positive direction. It is possible to rotate several joints at the same time. It should be noted that trying to rotate a joint outside its joint range is not recommended.
